{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 7-year-old girl who has already started her menstrual period, indicating precocious puberty. Precocious puberty is defined as the onset of secondary sexual characteristics before the age of 8 in girls. Without treatment, the patient is at greatest risk for short stature as an adult. Precocious puberty can lead to premature closure of the growth plates, resulting in limited growth potential and shorter stature compared to peers. Delayed skeletal maturity, genu varum, and coarse facial features are not typically associated with precocious puberty.", "answer_choice": "B"}
